data.text:
Who is Ken Olin?

The most well-known actor, producer and director is Ken Olin. He is very dedicated and his work is highly appreciated by those around him.

What is Ken Olin’s net worth? Salary, Earnings

His current net worth is estimated at $25 million . As a result, he is one of the most successful directors, producers, and leading actors in America. He was very successful in the work he chose. Despite his celebrity and wealth, Ken Olin has made real estate investments.

Where was Ken Olin born? Ethnicity, Nationality, Family, Education

Ken Olin was born on July 30, 1954, in Chicago, Illinois, United States of America. He is 68 years old. He is also known as Kenneth Edward Olin, but most people just call him Ken. Ken comes from a celebrity family, as his entire family is involved in the entertainment industry. Ken is an ardent Christian.

He is a citizen of the United States. Ken is also of Caucasian descent. He, on the other hand, is finishing his education. Ken attended Putney School in Highland Park, Illinois, where he grew up. Later, he graduated from Pennsylvania State University with a degree in English Literature.

Is Ken Olin single? Relationship

He has a happy marriage. He is the father of two children, a son and a daughter. Patricia Wettig, a well-known American actress and playwright, is Ken’s wife. They got married in 1982. However, they have been married for 40 years. Both couples have made their mark in Hollywood.

How tall is Ken Olin? Weight, Hair color

He has a wonderful personality as well as a charming appearance. He is 5 feet and 11 inches tall. Meanwhile, his weight is not available. He has black hair and one black eye. He is wearing glasses. Ken’s hair is turning white due to his age of 68 . Ken Olin also maintains a healthy lifestyle. He has been eating right and following his diet plan.

How did Ken Olin begin his professional career?

Olin appeared in both “Hill Street Blues” and “Thirtysomething” from 1981 to 1987 and 1987 to 1991. He also appeared in the television movies “A Stoning in Fulham County” and “Flight 90: Disaster on the Potomac.” Olin has worked on such television shows as “Alias,” “The West Wing” and “Brothers & Sisters.”

In 1995, Ken played Bradly Morris Cunningham in the television series Dead by Sunset, which was based on the book of the same name. He also appeared in the films Queens Logic and Till There Was You. He also produced and directed episodes of The West Wing, Judging Amy, and Freaks and Geeks, as well as Alias.

He subsequently contributed to the television series “Brothers & Sisters,” which aired from 2006 to 2011 and won numerous awards. Ken later co-starred in the pilot for “Americana” before becoming an executive producer on the NBC drama “This Is Us.”
